alert.note: Alert for Coastal Ocean; Eastern Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ocean and southeastern Monmouth Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Toms River, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toms River, Asbury Park, Manasquan, Point Pleasant Beach, Mantoloking, Leisure Village, Dover Beaches North, Leisure Village East, Brick Township, Allenwood, Ramtown, Point Pleasant, Neptune City, Brielle, Spring Lake Heights, Bradley Beach, Spring Lake, Avon-By-the-sea, Sea Girt and Bay Head. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 85 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central and southern New Jersey.
